children.name: telephone
examples: to speak to someone by telephone - used especially in writing:
About five o'clock, a woman telephoned Bernstein.
For details of your nearest tourist office telephone 4127.
Mr Dodd telephoned this morning.
telephone for : điện thoại cho
Write or telephone for more information.

children.name: make a call
examples: to use the telephone to speak to someone:
Diana made a quick call to Munich before the meeting.
There’s a pay phone in the lobby if you need to make a telephone call.
Will you excuse me? I've got to make a phone call.
I've just got a couple of calls tomake.

children.name: phone
examples: ▪ I’ll phone you if there’s any news.
▪ Shall I ring Sarah to see if she wants to come out with us?
▪ Did anyone ring while I was out?
▪ Jill phoned to tell you she’ll see you tonight.
phone for
▪ Let’s phone for a pizza tonight.
phone round[UK]/ ring round[UK]
telephone several people or organizations, especially to get information gọi xoay vòng
▪ You’d better ring round some travel agents to get some prices.

children.name: call
examples: Can you call Becky before six?
She called about twenty minutes ago.
call forgọi cho
I’ll call for a taxi now.
call around[US]/callround[UK] gọi xung quanh
call several people or organizations, especially to get information
I called round to see if anyone knew where Tom was.
His secretary started calling around to find out where the commission was meeting.

children.name: give sb a buzz
children.definition: /give sb a bell gọi cho ai đó
examples: [verb phrase-strong] [informal] to telephone someone:
I’ll give Larry a buzz. Maybe he’ll want to go too.
Can you give Mary a bell? She rang earlier.
Give me a ring if you decide you can come.
Give me a bell sometime next week, won't you?
I'll give you a buzz next week.

children.name: to telephone to sb who pay for the call
reverse the charges
children.definition: to make a telephone call that is paid for by the person receiving it
examples: If something goes wrong, call us and reverse the charges.

children.name: call collect
children.definition: to make a telephone call that is paid for by the person receiving it
examples: Call collect if you need to.
call sb collect
Anyone with information may call Doug Howarth collect at 555-0976.

children.name: hang up
examples: to end a phone call
If a caller is rude, just hang up.
hang up on sb(=end the phone call suddenly and unexpectedly) ngắt máy của ai
Mitchell was furious and hung up on him.

children.name: put the phone down
children.definition: to put down the receiver the part of a telephone you speak into after you have finished talking to someone:
examples: There was a long pause, and she was about to put the phone down when the voice came back again.

children.name: slam the phone down
examples: [verb phrase - fixed]ngắt máy, dập máy
to put the telephone down while someone is still speaking to you, because you are angry:
Call her. The worst thing she could do is slam down the phone.
slam the phone down/ slam down the phone on
He tried to talk to her, but she slammed the phone down on him.

children.name: ring off
examples: to end a telephone call:
I suppose I’d better ring off now -- we’ve been on the phone for over an hour.
She said "No, thank you" and rang off hurriedly.

children.name: hang up the phone
examples: to end a phone call
I said I’d be right there. I hung up the phone and grabbed my purse and car keys.

children.name: call (sb) back
examples: [I or T phrasal verb – M] to telephone someone again or to telephone someone who called you earlier.
‘Would you like to leave a message?’ ‘No, that’s okay. I’ll call back later.’
I’m afraid Mr Jones is in a meeting. Could you ring back in about an hour?
call sb back = call back sb
‘Does Jake want me to call him back?’ ‘No, he said to meet him at eight o'clock.’
Carl called back Mary after his meeting was over.
ring sb back = ring back sb
I'm a bit busy - can I ring you back later?

children.name: return a call
children.definition: gọi lại (vì ai đó đã gọi bạn nhưng bạn chưa bắt máy)
examples: to telephone someone because they telephoned you before when you werenotavailable- use this especially inbusinesscontexts:
Gage did not return phone calls from reporters to his office Monday.
Dr Shapiro is busy right now, but I’ll ask him to return your call when he’s free.

children.name: give sb a call
examples: [verb phrase-strong] [spoken] to speak to someone by telephone - use this especially when you are telling someone that youwilltelephone them, or when you areaskingthem to telephone:
Just give me a call if you need anything.
Why don’t I give you a ring later and find out when you’ll be free?

children.name: try again U
children.definition: try again thử gọi lại (do lúc trước có ai khác đang gọi cho người nhận)
examples: to telephone a number again because someone was already speaking on that line when you telephoned before:
▪ I’ve already phoned him twice, but I suppose I’d better try again.
try sb/a number again
▪ It’s engaged. I’ll try her again later.

children.name: to telephone for a special purpose
call up
examples: [I or T phrasal verb - M] to speak to someone by telephone, especially in order to have afriendlyconversation with them or to ask forinformation:
Your uncle rang up about an hour ago.
‘I don’t know what time the last train is.’ ‘Well, phone up and find out.’
call/ ring/ phone sb up
John called him up to make sure of the date of the graduation ceremony.
I might phone him up at home.
call/ ring/ phone up sb
Why don’t you call up Jackie and apologize?
She uses the office phone to phone up her friends in Sweden.

children.name: phone in
children.definition: gọi điện thoại đến ( báo ốm, nghỉ )
examples: [I phrasal verb] to telephone the place where you work in order to tell your employer something
She phoned insick(= saying that she was ill) this morning.
phone ingọi điện thoại đến ( bày tỏ ý kiến )
[I phrasal verb] to telephone a television or radio programme in order to express your opinion on a matter
Over three hundred people phoned in to complain.

children.name: be speaking to sb by telephone
be on the phone
children.definition: to be speaking to someone on the telephone:
examples: Rosie’s still on the phone.
There’s someone on the phone for you.
be on the phone tonói điện thoại với
He was on the phone to a friend when he noticed the smoke.
be on the phone withnói điện thoại với
How long are workers on the phone with customers?
have sb on the phone(to have sb calling you) ai đó gọi đến
Mr Rogers, I have Anita Payne on the phone for you.

children.name: screen your calls
examples: to delay your decision to speak to someone who is ringing you on the telephone until you can discover who they are, either by listening to them leaving a message on your answering machine or by seeing their telephone number shown on your telephone
I always screen my calls while I'm eating dinner.

children.name: answer
children.definition: to pick up the telephone and speak when it rings.
examples: I knocked on the door for a long time, but no one answered.
answer the phone/ telephone :
Could you answer the phone?
answer a call :
She still isn’t answering my calls.

children.name: get
examples: get the phone :
I’ll get the phone. I think it’s for me.
get it: [spoken]
The phone’s ringing. Do you want me to get it?

children.name: take a call U
children.definition: take a call/ˌteɪk ə ˈkɔːl/  nhận cuộc gọi ( thay cho ai đang vắng mặt )
examples: to speak to someone on the telephone because the person that they want to speak to is not available:
I was out that day, and my mother took the call.
Do you want to take the call in your office?
take a call for
Someone wants to speak to Professor Welch, but I can’t find him. Would you take the call for him please.

children.name: pick up
children.definition: pick (sth) up  trả lời điện thoại/ nhấc máy
examples: to answer a phone and talk to the person who is calling :
Come on Bob, pick up! I know you’re there.
I tried his home number but he didn't pick up.
pick up the phone/ pick the phone up :
Just pick up the phone and tell her to stop calling you here.
pick it up :
After the phone had rung twice, Joyce picked it up and said hello.

children.name: put sb through
examples: to connect a person using a telephone to the person they want to speak to
Could you put me throughtocustomer services, please?

children.name: transfer a call U
children.definition: transfer a call(= connect one to another person’s phone )
examples: The call was transferred to his secretary.

children.name: put a call through U
children.definition: put a call through/ put through a call
examples: (= transfer or make one )
Ask the receptionist to put your call throughtomy room.
She asked the switchboard to put through the call.
